channel.title: CVE Feed for IBM -- Connections
channel.description: The latest CVEs for IBM -- Connections

item.title: CVE-2017-1613|2024-08-05T13:39:31.528Z -- ibm -- connections
item.description: IBM Connections 6.0 could allow an unauthenticated remote attacker to gain unauthenticated or unauthorized access to non-sensitive Engagement Center template data. IBM X-Force ID: 132954.

item.title: CVE-2018-1935|2024-08-05T04:14:39.563Z -- ibm -- connections
item.description: IBM Connections 5.0, 5.5, and 6.0 could allow an authenticated user to obtain sensitive information from invalid request error messages. IBM X-Force ID: 153315.

item.title: CVE-2017-1498|2024-08-05T13:32:30.261Z -- ibm -- connections
item.description: IBM Connections 5.5 is vulnerable to cross-site scripting. This vulnerability allows users to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the Web UI thus altering the intended functionality potentially leading to credentials disclosure within a trusted session. IBM X-Force ID: 129020.

item.title: CVE-2017-1683|2024-08-05T13:39:31.991Z -- ibm -- connections
item.description: IBM Connections Engagement Center 6.0 is vulnerable to cross-site scripting. This vulnerability allows users to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the Web UI thus altering the intended functionality potentially leading to credentials disclosure within a trusted session. IBM X-Force ID: 134005.

item.title: CVE-2018-1791|2024-08-05T04:07:44.486Z -- ibm -- connections
item.description: IBM Connections 5.0, 5.5, and 6.0 is vulnerable to an External Service Interaction attack, caused by improper validation of a request property. By submitting suitable payloads, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to induce the Connections server to attack other systems. IBM X-Force ID: 148946.

item.title: CVE-2017-1682|2024-08-05T13:39:32.124Z -- ibm -- connections
item.description: IBM Connections 4.0, 4.5, 5.0, 5.5, and 6.0 is vulnerable to cross-site scripting. This vulnerability allows users to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the Web UI thus altering the intended functionality potentially leading to credentials disclosure within a trusted session. IBM X-Force ID: 134004.

item.title: CVE-2018-1896|2024-08-05T04:14:38.748Z -- ibm -- connections
item.description: IBM Connections 5.0, 5.5, and 6.0 is vulnerable to possible host header injection attack that could cause navigation to the attacker's domain. IBM X-Force ID: 152456.

item.title: CVE-2017-1748|2024-08-05T13:39:32.334Z -- ibm -- connections
item.description: IBM Connections 5.0, 5.5, and 6.0 could allow a remote attacker to conduct phishing attacks, using an open redirect attack. By persuading a victim to visit a specially-crafted Web site, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to spoof the URL displayed to redirect a user to a malicious Web site that would appear to be trusted. This could allow the attacker to obtain highly sensitive information or conduct further attacks against the victim. IBM X-Force ID: 135521.
